169 - 28 Dec 2023 02:46PM - +263 77 172 2758: Question 3:  The difference between a prosecutor and Attorney..  It is important to note that an attorney is a lawyer who practices as a professional advicer or advocate in legal matters. While a Prosecutor is a lawyer who determines whether to charge an individual for a crime and works to establish that person's guilt in court. He works to prove guilt beyond a reasonable doubt while the defence attorney attempts to create reasonable doubts so that their client is deemed innocent.. A good prosecutor is proficient in investigative work, writing, and sneaking. They can create a strong case against an accused and at ease in front of a jury or a judge .In addition to being experts in all facets of criminal law ,prosecutors must be skilled in communicating with other parties including the victims, defense witness, judges and law enforcement. A defence attorney is a prosecutor's counterpart. An attorney who protects a person or business against criminal accusations is a defence Attorney hence it can be argued that they is a different between an Attorney and a prosecutor..

146 - 27 Dec 2023 05:03PM - +263 78 610 6366: ?2    Please elaborate on the difference between Rights and Duties and give a furtherexplanation of the difference in Human Rights and Civil Rights. Rights and duties are two sides of the same coin. Rights are the entitlements that individuals or groups have, while duties are the obligations or responsibilities that individuals or groups have towards others or society as a whole.  Human rights are the basic rights and freedoms that are entitled to all human beings, regardless of their race, gender, nationality, religion, or any other status. These rights are inherent to human beings and are often enshrined in international law. Civil rights, on the other hand, are the rights that individuals have as citizens of a particular country. These rights are often related to political and social freedoms, such as the right to vote, freedom of speech, and freedom of assembly.  In summary, while rights and duties are interconnected, human rights and civil rights are distinct concepts that refer to different types of rights. ?3: What is the difference between a prosecutor and an attorney? - A prosecutor is a lawyer who represents the government in criminal cases. Their job is to investigate and prosecute individuals who are accused of committing crimes. They work closely with law enforcement officials to build a case against the defendant and present evidence in court.  An attorney, on the other hand, is a legal professional who provides legal advice and representation to individuals or organizations. Attorneys can specialize in various areas of law, such as criminal law, family law, or corporate law. They may represent clients in court or in negotiations with other parties.  In summary, while both prosecutors and attorneys are legal professionals, prosecutors work for the government to prosecute criminal cases, while attorneys provide legal advice and representation to individual clients. 4. There are three laws of thermodynamics known to man which are as follows the first law states when energy moves in or out of the system. The systems internal energy changes in accordance with the law of conservation of mass in simpler terms energy cannot be created or destroyed; it can only be converted from one form to another for example kinetic engery - the energy that an object possesses when it moves it is converted to heat energy when a driver presses the brakes on the car to slow it down. The second law states there exists a useful state variable called entropy. The change in entropy is equal th the heat transfer divided by the temperature. An example when we put an ice cube in a cup with water at room temperature. The water at room temperature releases off heat and the ice cube melts, hence the entropy of water drops. A valve is a device or natural object that regulates, directs or controls the flow of a fluid by opening, closing or partially obstructing various passageways. A butterfly valve is a type of a valve which is used to shut the flow of fluid. It is often said that butterfly valves can be used to regulate the flow of fluid, however it is not recommended using it as it can damage the valve disk and have a negative effect on the sealing properties. The valve requires less structural support than a ball valve of comparable diameter. These valves are commonly used in pipe lines in handling large fluid flows.

It is done to improve the mechanical properties of a material that include hardness, tensile, strength, shock, resistance, ductility and resistance to corrosion to improve mechinability and reduce brittleness and make the versatile. Heat treatment are also used in the manufacture of many other materials such as glass. Although the term heat treatment applies only to processes where the heating and cooling are done for specific of altering properties intentionally, heating and cooling often occur incidentally during other manufacturing such as hot forming or welding.

141 - 28 Dec 2023 05:50PM - +263 71 418 5330: 2. Please elaborate on the difference between Rights and Duties and give a further explanation of the difference in Human Rights and Civil rights.  Rights are defined as claims of an individual that are essential for the development of his or her own self and that are recognized by society or the State these include the right to life, the right to a fair trial, freedom from torture and other cruel and inhuman treatment, freedom of speech, freedom of religion, and the rights to health, education and an adequate standard of living.whilst a duty is something that someone is expected or required to do .Examples of duties  include obeying laws, paying taxes, defending the nation and serving on . Furthermore  human rights are the rights you have simply for being a human being which the right to a fair trial and presumption of innocence,freedom of thought, conscience and religion,freedom of opinion and expression,peaceful assembly,freedom of association,  participation in public affairsComparatively, civil rights are contextual meaning you are entitled to specific civil rights through being a citizen of a particular country, nation, or state. Civil rights are proclaimed by the government for the citizens of that country, while human rights are derived from natural law and are universally protected and applied.
142 - 28 Dec 2023 05:53PM - +263 71 418 5330: 3. What is the difference between a prosecutor and an attorney   One of the critical distinguishing factors is that a prosecutor typically works for the government agency bringing criminal charges and must prove the defendant's guilt beyond a reasonable doubt while the defense attorney represents the person accused of a crime and attempts to maintain the client's innocence . The prosecutor must charge the accused with a specific crime or crimes, then present evidence that proves beyond a reasonable doubt that the accused is guilty .The prosecutor must also gather evidence to present in court, interview and prepare witnesses to testify in court, research all aspects of the case to prepare for cross-examination, and prepare opening and closing statements.The defense attorney must defend their client against criminal charges. The client is innocent until proven guilty.The attorney represents the client‚Äôs best interests at all stages of legal proceedings from arraignment to sentencing.The attorney helps the client to avoid incriminating himself and making sure the client‚Äôs constitutional rights are not violated.

Entrepreneurship is often seen as the engine of economic growth, because it creates jobs, stimulates innovation, and boosts productivity. In addition, entrepreneurs often bring new ideas, technologies, and products to the market, which can help spur economic development. At the same time, a strong economy can encourage more people to start their own businesses, which in turn helps the economy grow even further. It's a cycle that benefits everyone involved. I'd like to talk about two other factors that are related to the relationship between entrepreneurship and economic development: risk-taking and innovation. Entrepreneurs often take risks in order to start and grow their businesses, and this risk-taking can lead to innovation, which in turn leads to economic growth. It's a virtuous cycle that can be very beneficial to society as a whole. Without entrepreneurs, we might not have some of the amazing technologies and products that we enjoy today, like smartphones, social media, or ride-sharing apps. So it's clear that entrepreneurship is closely tied to economic development..  Another important aspect of the relationship between entrepreneurship and economic development is the role of government. Governments often provide incentives and support for entrepreneurs, such as tax breaks, funding opportunities, and business incubators. This support can help entrepreneurs to succeed, and in turn, boost economic development. At the same time, governments can also create regulations and policies that make it harder for entrepreneurs to start and grow their businesses. So it's a delicate balance, and governments must be careful not to stifle innovation while still providing support for entrepreneurs.  3:GAAP stands for Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, and it's a set of rules and guidelines that accountants follow when preparing financial statements. GAAP is important because it helps to ensure that financial statements are prepared consistently and accurately, so that they can be used to make informed decisions about a company's financial health. Without GAAP, there would be no standard way to measure and report financial information, which could lead to confusion and even fraud. GAAP also helps to ensure that companies are disclosing all of the relevant information about their financial health to investors, regulators, and other interested parties.   Another important reason why GAAP is important is that it helps to create trust in the financial system. When companies are held to a high standard of accounting and reporting, it gives investors and other stakeholders confidence in the financial system as a whole. Without GAAP, there would be less transparency and confidence in the financial system, which could lead to instability and even crises. In short, GAAP is vital for ensuring the smooth functioning of the financial system.  4: Accounting standards are the specific rules and principles that govern how financial statements are prepared. These standards are typically set by a governing body, such as the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) in the United States. Accounting standards are mandatory because they help to ensure that all companies are using the same methods to prepare their financial statements. This allows for comparisons between companies and helps to ensure that financial statements are reliable and consistent. Without accounting standards, there would be no way to ensure that financial statements are fair and accurate.  The other important things to understand about accounting standards is that they are constantly evolving. As the economy and business world changes, so do the rules that govern financial reporting.Financial Accounting Standards Board(FASB), for example, regularly reviews and updates its standards to reflect changes in the marketplace. This ensures that accounting standards are always relevant and effective.  In addition, it's important to note that different countries have their own sets of accounting standards. For example, the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) are used by many countries around the world. However, the U.S. still uses GAAP for most publicly traded companies   5: Accounting and auditing are two closely related, but distinct activities. Accounting refers to the process of preparing and reporting financial information, while auditing is the process of verifying and evaluating that financial information. In other words, accounting is the process of recording and reporting financial transactions, while auditing is the process of checking that the information reported is accurate and reliable. Both activities are important in maintaining financial transparency and integrity.Accounting provides the data, and auditing ensures that the data is reliable.  Accounting as the "back-end" of a company's financial reporting, while auditing is the "front-end." Accounting is the day-to-day process of recording transactions, maintaining records, and preparing financial statements. Auditing, on the other hand, is the process of independently assessing the accuracy and reliability of those financial statements. Auditing often takes place after the accounting is done, as a way to verify the information that has been reported. Auditors may also provide recommendations for improving accounting procedures and internal controls.

This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills. A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative. *Required Skill-Set for BA LLB* It is rightly said that learning is an on ‚Äì going process and this holds true especially in the aspect of personal and professional development. Although an individual may possess certain skills they need to be improved and developed constantly. A few key skills that are of paramount importance in the field of law are: *Good Written Communication*‚Äì Writing forms a major part of the work in in the legal profession. This requires a good level of English proficiency. *Good Verbal Communication*‚Äì A lot depends on how well the legal professional can express his or her case, arguments and generally converse with clients and authorities. Good verbal communication ensures good expression and understanding which are crucial for a successful career in law. *Good Time Management*‚Äì In the legal profession, time management is very crucial. The art of delegating tasks, working within deadlines, and prioritizing tasks to achieve success is very essential. *A great degree of self-confidence*‚Äì This profession needs a high degree of self-confidence to win the clients‚Äô trust. A strong belief in yourself will go a long way in winning arguments and cases. *An analytical mind and good research skills*‚Äì A case with proper research and well-reasoned out and evaluated argument stands a very high chance of success. *High EQ (Emotional Quotient)*‚Äì Individuals in the legal profession, especially lawyers, must learn to be empathetic. *Tech Savvy*‚Äì In the rapidly developing and evolving technological world, they must be abreast of the latest technology to understand and use it, as and when needed. They need to use technology to their advantage to improve their efficiency and chances of success. *Good Commercial awareness*‚Äì This is not only restricted to being aware of the current trends and technology, prevalent in the world of business and law, but also being aware of the developments in the world of business and law, both nationally and globally. *A high degree of patience*‚Äì This is a much needed skill, since you deal with different types of people and some cases and procedures stretch over a period of time which need a lot of patience and careful handling. *Team player skills*‚Äì Since a legal professional will deal with a lot of people therefore to be effective they need to bond with people. 77 - 28 Dec 2023 12:49PM - Garima Edoofa: *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is a 5-year course that integrates Arts with Law. It covers subjects related to Arts fields such as Economics, History, Sociology Political Science, etc. alongside specialized fields of law like Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Patent Law, Administrative Law, Tax Law, International Law and Labor Law. This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. The time spent during this course is made interesting by constantly organizing the case studies and mock court drills alongside theoretical lectures. In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. It enables the students to think critically in a creative way and come up with innovative ideas to tackle the aforesaid legal issues. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is meant for candidates who are suitable for concise writing, verbal questioning and complex information interpretation. The aspirants having a strong evaluation and analytical skills can be a good fit for this course. The students who dream of make a career in law and contribute towards society can take this course and fulfill their dream. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills. A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative. *Required Skill-Set for BA LLB* It is rightly said that learning is an on ‚Äì going process and this holds true especially in the aspect of personal and professional development. Although an individual may possess certain skills they need to be improved and developed constantly. A few key skills that are of paramount importance in the field of law are: *Good Written Communication*‚Äì Writing forms a major part of the work in in the legal profession. The written communication involves letters, documents, notices, and so on. The documents must be grammatically correct and error free. This requires a good level of English proficiency. *Good Verbal Communication*‚Äì A lot depends on how well the legal professional can express his or her case, arguments and generally converse with clients and authorities. Good verbal communication ensures good expression and understanding which are crucial for a successful career in law. *Good Time Management*‚Äì In the legal profession, time management is very crucial. The art of delegating tasks, working within deadlines, and prioritizing tasks to achieve success is very essential. *A great degree of self-confidence*‚Äì This profession needs a high degree of self-confidence to win the clients‚Äô trust. A strong belief in yourself will go a long way in winning arguments and cases. *An analytical mind and good research skills*‚Äì A case with proper research and well-reasoned out and evaluated argument stands a very high chance of success. *High EQ (Emotional Quotient)*‚Äì Individuals in the legal profession, especially lawyers, must learn to be empathetic. *Tech Savvy*‚Äì In the rapidly developing and evolving technological world, they must be abreast of the latest technology to understand and use it, as and when needed. They need to use technology to their advantage to improve their efficiency and chances of success. *Good Commercial awareness*‚Äì This is not only restricted to being aware of the current trends and technology, prevalent in the world of business and law, but also being aware of the developments in the world of business and law, both nationally and globally. *A high degree of patience*‚Äì This is a much needed skill, since you deal with different types of people and some cases and procedures stretch over a period of time which need a lot of patience and careful handling. *Team player skills*‚Äì Since a legal professional will deal with a lot of people therefore to be effective they need to bond with people. The art of getting work done and obtaining information though networking and working with people helps in attaining the objectives.

66 - 28 Dec 2023 11:41AM - Gurvinder: *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is a 5 year course which integrates Arts with Law. It covers subjects related to Arts field such as Economics, History, Sociology and Political Science etc. alongside specialized fields of law like Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Patent Law, Administrative Law, Tax Law, International Law and Labor Law. This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. The time spent during this course is made interesting by constantly organizing the case studies and mock court drills alongside theoretical lectures. In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. It enables the students to think critically in a creative way and come up with innovative ideas to tackle the aforesaid legal issues. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is meant for candidates who are suitable for concise writing, verbal questioning and complex information interpretation. The aspirants having a strong evaluation and analytical skills can be a good fit for this course. The students who dream of make a career in law and contribute towards society can take this course and fulfill their dream. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills. A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.

66 - 28 Dec 2023 11:41AM - Gurvinder: *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is a 5 year course which integrates Arts with Law. It covers subjects related to Arts field such as Economics, History, Sociology and Political Science etc. alongside specialized fields of law like Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Patent Law, Administrative Law, Tax Law, International Law and Labor Law. This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. The time spent during this course is made interesting by constantly organizing the case studies and mock court drills alongside theoretical lectures. In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. It enables the students to think critically in a creative way and come up with innovative ideas to tackle the aforesaid legal issues. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is meant for candidates who are suitable for concise writing, verbal questioning and complex information interpretation. The aspirants having a strong evaluation and analytical skills can be a good fit for this course. The students who dream of make a career in law and contribute towards society can take this course and fulfill their dream. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills. A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.

104 - 28 Dec 2023 03:00PM - Gurvinder: The syllabus of the course may vary from college to college, however, the structure and topics covered, remain the same.  *Career Prospects*  After successful completion of Bachelor of Business Administration course, graduates can either opt for higher education or seek employment in different sectors. Generally, students pursue an MBA (Masters of Business Administration) course and specialize in a particular department or field of study. Masters or post-graduation in Management Studies, Human Resource Development Management, Financial Planning and Wealth Management etc. are considered to be good options. A combination of BBA and MBA is considered helpful in gaining constant promotions and high-salary job in the business world.  *BBA* course opens up a spectrum of job opportunities in the fields of Advertising, Academic Institutes, Banking, Consultancies, Foreign Exchange, Hotel Management, Manufacturing Industry, IT and ITES, Urban infrastructure & real estate management and various Government services. A 12. ‚Å†B 13. ‚Å†C 14. ‚Å†B 15. ‚Å†A 16. ‚Å†B  SECTION 5 ESSAY WRITING  Life in Rwanda, 16 years after the devastating genocide of 1994, has had some remarkable strides towards reconciliation, healing, and progress. The country has gone through a tragic past in hopes of reconciliation and unity world wide. This essay will cover the social, political and economic impacts on Rwanda after the genocide.  Rwanda was devastated emotionally, socially, and economically in the wake of the genocide. But the nation started a healing process under President Paul Kagame's inspiring direction. The quest of justice and reconciliation by Rwanda during the genocide has been one of the country's greatest features. The Gacaca courts are now community-based tribunals that aim to address the large number of violators and offer an environment for justice and truth-telling.  Furthermore, the emphasis on national identity of Rwanda and unity has been crucial in building a sense of unity among its citizens. The government's prioritisation of Rwandan identity over cultural differences has made an important contribution to the restoration and unity of the society.  Rwanda has undergone significant economic growth. The nation has experienced remarkable expansion in industries such as agriculture, tourism, and technology. With projects like the Kigali Development City powering the nation's technical developments, Kigali, the capital city, has emerged as a centre for innovation and technology in Africa. The country's natural beauty, such the magnificent mountain gorillas in Volcanoes National Park, has been highlighted deeply, demonstrating the development in tourism. These visitors come from all over the world.  Socially, there are some problems that the citizens still undergo. The genocide tragedy that had occurred still lingers which is affecting individuals and communities. Even though there has been some progress in the healing and reconciliation process, more has to be done to guarantee that all Rwandans have a sense of justice and closure. Further, opinions about Rwanda's political system are mixed. Although the government has received praise for its efforts in reconstructing the country and for its dedication to gender equality, as is demonstrated by the high percentage of women in parliament, concerns have also been expressed over political liberties and human rights.As it is seen that Rwanda is a dictatorship country.  Rwanda is a reminder to the human spirit perseverance and the ability to rise from the ashes of sorrow, despite these difficulties. Other countries coping with the impact of war and genocide can draw inspiration from the nation's achievements. In summary, 16 years after the genocide, Rwanda is a country that has come a long way in terms of growth, healing, and reconciliation. The change of Rwanda has been largely attributed to the people's determination and perseverance as well as their visionary leadership. Even though there are still difficulties, Rwanda's development is proof of the strength of cooperation, forgiveness, and the human spirit to rise above even the most trying times in history.  SECTION 6 PERSONALITY TEST ‚ÄúMy inspiration Story‚Äù  Title: "My Journey"  In a small city in Lusaka Zambia, lived a girl named Martha. She basically lived in a boarding school where she was taking her tertiary education. She didn‚Äôt know what career path she wanted to undergo . She was lost and confused. Martha loved attending the computer class that was introduced to her. She especially enjoyed going to the labs for practicals because she always preferred practicality to theory. She was always curious and intrigued, on how the machine works and the wonders it can do.she engaged with the machine that seemed to hold within it a universe waiting to be unraveled.  When she first started learning how to code, she was intrigued. It was like learning a new language, a way to communicate with a computer. This brought about some unanticipated passion.  As she delved deeper into learning about computers, Martha discovered the power technology has and the amazing things it can do with just a line of code.‚Äîa tool not just for convenience but a canvas for innovation and change.  Martha‚Äôs had completed her tertiary education but at that moment, she still wasn‚Äôt sure about her career path .The turning point came when Martha attended an event with a female guest speaker, a trailblazer in the tech industry, sharing her journey. She was amazed when she saw that a woman is very much capable of achieving her goals and dreams through technology. In that moment, Martha imagined herself in the speaker‚Äôs story‚Äîa girl with dreams of doing anything she has can dream of with technology.  Driven by the speaker's words and her newfound passion, Martha had decided to embrace computer science as her career path. She spent countless hours learning, coding, and pushing the boundaries of her understanding. She spent most of her time researching about it and what it involves entirely.  When she applied for the course and was accepted at a university, she was overjoyed and couldn‚Äôt wait to start learning.Challenges emerged along the way when she started learning about the complex algorithms, debugging dilemmas. She had some self doubt and wondered if she can really handle the course she is undertaking.  She didn‚Äôt give up. She continued to study hard and practice as much as possible to improve her knowledge and skills. As she was studying,her inspiration blossomed into a resolute decision‚Äîto delve deeper into technology as her permanent career path. She realized that win the realms of technology, there was so much she would create and accomplish.  In choosing computer science, Martha didn‚Äôt just embrace a course but embraced a vision‚Äîa vision to be a part of a transformative force, shaping the future through lines of code and engineering , and inspiring others to embark on their own journeys into the boundless realm of technology. In technology she had found a sense of belonging and surety that being involved in creating and improving technology is something that will help her achieve her dream of having an impact. <This message was edited>

20 - 28 Dec 2023 11:56AM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
21 - 28 Dec 2023 11:56AM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
22 - 28 Dec 2023 11:56AM - Gurvinder: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program just in the last year. We are associated with more than 200 schools with more than 250 Headmaster, Chairman SDC, and Educationists that are associated with EDOOFA. *Our associate partner, Mr Shorwi Kawadza*, is a reputed Educationalist from Zimbabwe and is the Principal of Hartzell High School. *Hartzell High School*, Mutare has collaborated with us for the past Four Years from which more than 80 students have enrolled and arrived in India already. The Child of the DEO, Manicaland *Sir Abson Mapfumo* is a part of the Edoofa Scholarship Program. *United College of Education*, Bulawayo the best college in Bulawayo is Associated with EDOOFA, and Respected *Sir Adam Luthuli* has her daughter enrolled under the Edoofa Scholarship Program. Similarly, the Daughter of Mr.N.M Maposa, Headmaster of Chibuwe High, the son of Ms Christina Rockson, The Principal of Hilltop Christian High School, South Africa, and the child of *Mrs. Aleta Makomeke*, DEO at Masvingo province are Edoofians and we have many more success stories from St. David's Bonda High, St. Albert‚Äôs, Christ Ministries, Advent Hope Academy, Nhowe Mission, Nyazura High, First Class High, etc.

91 - 28 Dec 2023 04:14PM - Gurvinder: A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.

SECTION 6  Deep down in the roots of Chivhu there was a young man named Rutendo. One day he was once walking through the woods when he came across a wise old owl perched on a tree branch.He then took a while and asked the owl the secret to live a good life .The owl looked down at the boy and replied, "The secret is to always be kind to others, even when they are not kind to you." The boy thought about this and then asked himself if someone was really mean to him and what he should do then.The owl then encouraged him to be kind at all cost. Whilst she was in his confusion state he wondered how he can be kind to someone who is being mean to him. The Owl smiled at him and told him sometimes the kindest thing to do is simply walking away.One can not control how other people behave but can control how to react to them. He was surprised to find that as he practiced kindness, he began to feel happier and more at peace. He also noticed that the people around him seemed to be kinder, too. And whenever someone was unkind, he followed the owl's advice and walked away. In this way, he was able to create a life filled with happiness and peace. And he never forgot the owl's wise words: "The secret to living a good life is to always be kind to others, even when they are not kind to you." The boy carried this lesson with him for the rest of his life, and he passed it on to others.

195 - 28 Dec 2023 02:18PM - Harmehak: Zvikomborero, Senior Academician Mr Piyush were in Zimbabwe for about 90 days, from his experience and what a lot of my Zimbabwean students have shared, having a tertiary education can end up costing a student roughly around $3000-$4000 a year in Zimbabwe,  While cost of education is limited to $1200-$1500 a year, cost of living in Zimbabwe is quite high, where even a staple meal of Sadza and curry costs a student $1 for one time. 50 - 28 Dec 2023 07:30PM - Kunal: *Bachelor of Business Administration or BBA* is a 3-year professional undergraduate course in Business Management. BBA course equips you with the right knowledge and skills in business and management and impart knowledge of the principles which are perfect for a career in the corporate world. A degree in Business Administration solidifies your base for your future Business and management career goals. Successful graduates of this course can opt for a range of jobs from sectors like human resource, finance, marketing, sales, management, government, and education.  Financial Analyst, Real Estate Management, Operation Management, Business Development Executive, Project Manager (IT), Data Analyst, Human Resources (HR) Manager Supply Chain Manager, Production Manager, Marketing Executive etc. are some such profiles which successful graduates interested in pursuing a job can opt for.  *What is BBA about?*  Bachelor of Business Administration is one of the most sought after bachelor degree programs aftment. The course is designed in a way to train students effectively in management education and communication skills which further inculcates entrepreneurship skills. It also gives you a platform for pursuing courses like MBA. To do well in this class 12th. It includes complete knowledge of leadership and management. The course can be pursued either Full-Time or Part-Time i.e. through Correspondence or Distance Education, depending on one‚Äôs preference. The maximum duration of the course is 5-years for those who wish to pursue it through correspondence or distance-learning mode.  BBA degree allows candidates to enter into the field of management and teaches them various aspects that are necessary for effective business manageield, students must possess leadership qualities, decision making skills, good oral and written communication skills Bachelor of Business Administration course is designed to impart knowledge of skills in business management and administration.Throughout the duration of the course, students are regularly assessed through quizzes, class tests, viva, presentations, submission of assignments, performance in computer lab and practical. Most colleges also emphasize on a local project/ internship which is usually carried out after the fourth semester and this becomes a practical training project for the students. The final assessment for the course includes a minimum CGPA of 5.0 in all semesters, completion of the project work and lab practical.  The syllabus of the course may vary from college to college, however, the structure and topics covered, remain the same.  *Career Prospects*  After successful completion of Bachelor of Business Administration course, graduates can either opt for higher education or seek employment in different sectors. Generally, students pursue an MBA (Masters of Business Administration) course and specialize in a particular department or field of study. Masters or post-graduation in Management Studies, Human Resource Development Management, Financial Planning and Wealth Management etc. are considered to be good options. A combination of BBA and MBA is considered helpful in gaining constant promotions and high-salary job in the business world.  BBA course opens up a spectrum of job opportunities in the fields of Advertising, Academic Institutes, Banking, Consultancies, Foreign Exchange, Hotel Management, Manufacturing Industry, IT and ITES, Urban infrastructure & real estate management and various Government services. Top recruiters for BBA graduates are Accenture, Genpact, TCS, HCL Technologies, International Business Machines (IBM) Corp to name a few.  Some of the major job profiles associated with BBA degree are as follows:  *Financial Analyst* *Production Manager* *Operations Team Leader* *Business Development Executive* *Real Estate Management* *Project Manager (IT)* *Data Analyst* *Human Resources (HR) Manager* *Marketing Executive*

70 - 28 Dec 2023 02:43PM - Pallika Edoofa: *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is a 5 year course which integrates Arts with Law. It covers subjects related to Arts field such as Economics, History, Sociology and Political Science etc. alongside specialized fields of law like Criminal Law, Corporate Law, Patent Law, Administrative Law, Tax Law, International Law and Labor Law. This course goes beyond the tedious classroom learning. The time spent during this course is made interesting by constantly organizing the case studies and mock court drills alongside theoretical lectures. In *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* course, the focus is on developing skills that will help the students to tackle any kind of legal problem they may face in the future. The objective of this course is to equip the students with an expert knowledge and a unique perspective on it. It enables the students to think critically in a creative way and come up with innovative ideas to tackle the aforesaid legal issues. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* is meant for candidates who are suitable for concise writing, verbal questioning and complex information interpretation. The aspirants having a strong evaluation and analytical skills can be a good fit for this course. The students who dream of make a career in law and contribute towards society can take this course and fulfill their dream. *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills. A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative. *Required Skill-Set for BA LLB* It is rightly said that learning is an on ‚Äì going process and this holds true especially in the aspect of personal and professional development. Although an individual may possess certain skills they need to be improved and developed constantly. A few key skills that are of paramount importance in the field of law are: *Good Written Communication*‚Äì Writing forms a major part of the work in in the legal profession. The written communication involves letters, documents, notices, and so on. The documents must be grammatically correct and error free. This requires a good level of English proficiency. *Good Verbal Communication*‚Äì A lot depends on how well the legal professional can express his or her case, arguments and generally converse with clients and authorities. Good verbal communication ensures good expression and understanding which are crucial for a successful career in law. *Good Time Management*‚Äì In the legal profession, time management is very crucial. 221 - 28 Dec 2023 11:06AM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program. *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their Grade 12 result is out). *Phase 3:* Once the final Grade 12 results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents. *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*
222 - 28 Dec 2023 11:06AM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

218 - 28 Dec 2023 09:31PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program. *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their Grade 12 result is out). *Phase 3:* Once the final Grade 12 results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents. *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*
219 - 28 Dec 2023 09:31PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. 253 - 28 Dec 2023 05:43PM - +263 73 398 2320: Now you will have to appear for a test which is of 30 to 45 minutes, you can submit the test responses, by 05 PM.  *MAXIMUM MARKS: 50*  *_SECTION 1_*  Name as per School Record - Tafadzwa C Chirembwe Gender-Male Date of Birth as per School Record- 08/06/05 Father's Name- Soviet Chirembwe Mother's Name- Patience Chirembwe Email Address- Tafadzwa@g.mail Parent's email address- sovietchiret@g-mail.com  Section 2 1.A 2.D 3.D 4.A 5.A  Section 3 6.C 7.B 8.C 9.D  Section 4 10.D 11.A 12.B 13.C 14.B 15.D 16.B  Section 5  The issue of food insecurity and poor nutrition is a complex and multifaceted problem that affects millions of people in Africa. One of the contributing factors to this issue is the state of agriculture on the continent. Many smallholder farmers in Africa are confronted with outdated farming techniques, a lack of access to modern technologies, and limited resources, such as fertile land and adequate irrigation systems. As a result, agricultural yields in many parts of Africa are low, leading to food shortages and malnutrition. The lack of access to diverse and nutritious food sources is particularly detrimental to children, pregnant women, and other vulnerable groups. Additionally, the impact of climate change has further strained the agricultural sector in Africa, making it even more challenging for farmers to produce enough food to meet the demands of their communities. In conclusion, while it is true that many Africans suffer from food insecurity and poor nutrition due to inadequate agricultural practices, it is important to recognize that this problem is not solely caused by farmers. It is a complex issue that requires a comprehensive and multi-faceted approach that includes investment in modern agricultural technologies, improved access to education and training, and increased support for smallholder farmers."  Section 6  "I used to believe that life was a series of impossible challenges. Like a puzzle with no solution, I struggled to see the bigger picture and understand my purpose. But one day, I decided to take a different approach. I began to look at each obstacle as an opportunity for growth and learning. I started to focus on the journey, rather than the destination. Every experience, good or bad, became a stepping stone to a better version of myself. As I embraced this new mindset, I found that my struggles became my greatest teachers. I learned to be resilient, to adapt and to find strength in adversity. Today, I stand before you, not as someone who has overcome all obstacles, but as someone who has learned to embrace them. I have discovered that life is not about reaching a final destination, but about growing and evolving. So I encourage you to embrace your own journey, and to see each challenge as an opportunity for growth. Remember, it's not about the destination, it's about the journey."

26 - 28 Dec 2023 03:13PM - Tushti: Alright, let me give you a brief introduction to the Program you have applied for
27 - 28 Dec 2023 03:14PM - Tushti: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4000 students from different countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
28 - 28 Dec 2023 03:14PM - Tushti: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2000 students enrolled in the program just in the last year. We are associated with more than 200 schools with more than 250 Headmaster, Chairman SDC, and Educationists that are associated with EDOOFA. Our associate partner, Mr Shorwi Kawadza, is a reputed Educationalist from Zimbabwe and is the Principal of Hartzell High School. Hartzell High School, Mutare has collaborated with us for the past Four Years from which more than 80 students have enrolled and arrived in India already. The Child of the DEO, Manicaland Sir Abson Mapfumo is a part of the Edoofa Scholarship Program. 138 - 28 Dec 2023 04:48PM - Tushti: The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn *scholarship credits* (based on student‚Äôs performance) that is equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing ‚Äì just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies, needs, and tactics. Graduates with this degree have opportunity for the industries like Coaching Centres, Computer Science and Engineering Consultancies, Computer Science and Engineering Department, Home Tuitions, Private Tuitions, Research and Development Agencies and Schools etc.   B.Sc. Computer Science course is designed in a way, which covers all the aspects required to prepare students to make a career in Software Industry. The systematic study of computers and its applications enable students to imbibe logical and analytical skills which helps them excel in this field.  Computing problems need solutions which can be executed in the real world for which programming codes are taught to the students. All these methods develop a practical approach in students which is a vital part for Computer science Students.  B.Sc. Computer Science includes the concepts of Software Engineering in its syllabus for students to have an ease in working with Software Engineers in the industry. The syllabus prepares a knowledge base for research and development in Computer science for students.  *Who should opt for B.Sc Computer Science?* B.Sc Computer Science can prove to be the right choice for students who are intrigued by Computer Science and want to explore it. Those who are familiar with word processing skills, spreadsheet skills, web navigation skills and enjoy learning these can go for B.Sc. Computer Science as well. 27 - 28 Dec 2023 03:02PM - Tushti: Shumirai let me explain to you that there are two kinds of programs that provide assistance to the students because a lot of times parents and students themselves misunderstand what a Scholarship actually means.  *1. Scholarships* *2. Sponsorships*  Scholarships make education *affordable* for the students by reducing their *Tuition Fees*, now a lot of times parents and students consider that a Domestic Scholarship would be the same as an International Scholarship, but to understand the difference between them, consider yourself applying for an education in your own country with the help of a scholarship. Now after the scholarship when your tuition fee would be reduced, eventually your entire cost of education would be reduced because being a citizen of the country, you wouldn't be required to spend any fees on Accommodation and feeding separately since in that case, students would be staying with their families. However, if I personally plan to study in Zimbabwe with the same scholarship, I would have to incur some costs on Accommodation and Feeding because I am not a Zimbabwean Citizen. So a lot of times parents and students consider International Scholarship and Domestic Scholarship one and the same thing, but in reality, they aren't.  Sponsorships, on the other hand, take care entirely of a student's education, but because Sponsorships are provided by only a few organizations, there are a lot of terms and conditions which a student might need to follow in order to get the sponsorship, the most common term is that a student after completion of the course would have to work for the organization providing the sponsorship for a period of time.
